p: Viral infection with HEV is self-limited and case fatality rates of 0.5â€“4 % have been described. Pregnant women particularly those in the second and third trimester are affected more frequently and have a worse outcome. The mortality in these patients is from 5 to 25 %. In an epidemic in India, clinical hepatitis developed in 17.3 % of pregnant women. Fulminant hepatic failure was seen in approximately 22 % of the infected pregnant women with an increased frequency of complications.
